chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daquin L Wiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 5-20-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS served.
- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

- The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
- Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 5-20-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Daquin L Wiley in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Daquin L Wiley in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Daquin L Wiley not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition.  received and filed

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Daquin L Wiley not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daquin L Wiley in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Daquin L Wiley in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense needs more time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DRH

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Daquin L Wiley in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Daquin L Wiley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daquin L Wiley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
